name: Microwaist
description:
It's generally hard to get Stable Diffusion to make "a thin waist". The waist size of a character is often tied to things like leg width, breast size, character height, etc.

This is meant to fix that, to the extreme if you wish.

Available in Lora and Embedding format.

modelVersions.name: 0.3 Lora
modelVersions.description: Handles texture on the abs and back much more smoothly, and integrates better with other LoRas. Enjoy!

modelVersions.name: 0.2b Lora
modelVersions.description:
Lora version!

Using the model, I made new data to train a Lora.

This one should be better about not always making thong straps on the hip and unbuckling pants buttons.

Keep the feedback coming! I'm looking to make the next version based on your feedback!

If you like the shape of the waist you're getting, but not the texture (eg line up the center), use a "from" clause such as [<lora:microwaist:1>::10] which, with 20 steps, removes the embedding before final details are added, but after it has created the initial waist shape.

modelVersions.name: 0.1b Embedding
modelVersions.description:
Initial release to get feedback from the community. What works? What doesn't work? What do you like about it? What could I do better?

Notes:

Some models really don't want rail-thin waists. However, this should shrink the waist on characters for all models.

If you see a line up the center of the belly, use a "from" clause such as [microwaist::10] which, with 20 steps, removes the embedding before final details are added, but after it has created the initial waist shape

Demo images use:
SD1.5

ProtogenPhotorealism

Berrymix

HassansBlend

DreamlikeSamKushinov

Grapefruit

Suggest starting with [(microwaist:1.3)::10] on DreamlikeSamKushinov with 20 step count to get great results immediately, and then fan out from there.
